alert.note: Alert for Clark; Dallas; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 9:55PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Clark, northwestern Dallas and southeastern Hot Spring Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 955 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whelen Springs, or 13 miles east of Prescott, moving north at 80 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Arkadelphia... Gurdon... Caddo Valley... Whelen Springs... Beirne... Gum Springs in Clark County... Richwoods... Donaldson... Friendship... Lower Lake Recreation Area... Curtis... Joan... De Roche... Dalark... Griffithtown... Midway in Hot Spring County... This includes Interstate 30 between mile markers 61 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas.
